instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA: What is PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA? PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state that powers the SMC that comes from PP3V3_S5. A blown or corroded L4901 inductor behind it can kepe it from working, inductor number will differ depending on your board. .
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
threads.message:
I thought the SMC would be causing the issue with the charger light not showing at all and the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> not boosting. Changing twice neither have changed I think I reballed a couple of those SMC's more than once to no avail. The fact that I have PPBUS G3H at 12.25 and no charger light should imply the SMC, correct?

SMC's did come from other 3115 boards. One of the donor boards I pulled SMC from was known to boot but had other strange issue I couldn't resolve.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
threads.message:
Did you check first voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus???
Did you test the board alone on the desk?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
threads.message:
Tested on desk.
Diode on battery bus lines is .527 and .526
3.49V with charger only at pins 4 and 6  J6950

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
threads.message:
Did you try another DCIN board?
Post <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01 voltages.
Check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to central pin of Magsafe connector.
There should be a 20 ohms resistor, or just a small coil, in series.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
threads.message:
YEs tried a couple different DCIN boards.
+3V at pins1,4,5 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and 1,2,4,5 of <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>
22 ohms from pin 5 <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to center pin of MS connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No charger light, PPBUS G3H is 12.25, CHanged SMC twice after reflow.
threads.message:
Looks like you have SMC issue.
Checl ALL signals and voltages for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2) at page 45.
Be sure to get oscillation at Y5010.
